It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its linear, narrow leaves that form a rosette structure. The plant produces small, clustered spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Brasolia linearistelidia is considered a conservation concern.
